page.title: 09INDUSTRY IN BENTHAM
page.content: The biggest Industrial concern is Angus Fire Armour Ltd. All kinds of fire fighting equipment are made such as foam, hose, fire extinguishers and sprinklers, some of which are exported. The Bentham works employ about 600 people. At the new industrial units is Gravure Print Ltd. They print and emboss wallpaper. At Bentham Body Builders (previously the egg hatcheries) horse boxes and cattle boxes are made for sale to local farmers. At what was once the Low Bentham Silk Mill there is a variety of small businesses. The largest belongs to E. Woof, who manufactures farm buildings and equipment. At the Trout Farm eggs are hatched and grown into table sized trout. Large trout are for re-stocking the rivers. Trout are sold at the shop and to markets and hotels.
